name: HCL AppScan Enterprise
description: Perform dynamic scans via creation and execution of DAST scans in AppScan Enterprise.
author: HCLTechnologies
instanceNameFormat: Run HCL AppScan Enterprise Security Test

inputs.name: ServiceEndPointAse
inputs.label: Credentials
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the credentials to use for running a scan. Add credentials using the HCL AppScan Enterprise Service. How do I get my credentials?

inputs.name: jobName
inputs.label: Job Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name for the scan job. The job name will be suffixed with the job creation time stamp.

inputs.name: folderId
inputs.label: Folder ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: The folder ID for the scan. How do I get my Folder ID?

inputs.name: templateId
inputs.label: Template ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: The template ID for the scan. How do I get my Template ID?

inputs.name: testPolicyId
inputs.label: Test Policy ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: The test policy ID for the scan. How do I get my Test Policy ID?

inputs.name: applicationId
inputs.label: Application ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: The application ID for the scan. How do I get my Application ID? Application ID is required to generate a PDF report.

inputs.name: startingURL
inputs.label: Starting URL
inputs.helpMarkDown: The URL where the scan will start exploring the site.

inputs.name: loginMethod
inputs.label: Select the login method

options.Manual: Recorded Login - Login to the application using recorded login sequence.
options.Automatic: Automatic Login - Login to the application automatically using the credentials.

inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the login method for web application.

inputs.name: trafficFile
inputs.label: Login Traffic File

validation.message: Enter a valid .exd or .har or .dast.config or .login file.

inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide a path to the Login Traffic File data, to use as part of a new scan. Supported file formats are EXD, HAR, DAST.CONFIG and LOGIN.

inputs.name: autoUserName
inputs.label: User Name
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the user name for your web application.

inputs.name: autoPassword
inputs.label: Password
inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide the password for your web application. Use a new variable with its lock enabled on the Variables tab to encrypt this value.

inputs.name: scanOptions
inputs.label: Scan

options.1: Full automatic scan - Automatically explore and test your web application. The test stage will run on both automatic and manual explore data.
options.3: Test Only - The test will run only on external recorded manual explore data. Add the path in Manual explore.

inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the scan option.

inputs.name: manualExplorePathAuto
inputs.label: Manual explore (externally recorded) Path

validation.message: Enter a valid .exd or .har or .dast.config file.

inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide a path to the Manual explore data, to use as part of a new scan. Supported Manual explore file formats are: EXD, HAR and DAST.CONFIG.

inputs.name: manualExplorePathTest
inputs.label: Manual explore (externally recorded) Path

validation.message: Enter a valid .exd or .har or .dast.config file.

inputs.helpMarkDown: Provide a path to the Manual explore data, to use as part of a new scan. Supported Manual explore file formats are: EXD, HAR and DAST.CONFIG.

inputs.name: optimization
inputs.label: Test Optimization

options.Fast: Fast - Scan will find about 97% vulnerabilities of equivalent non-optimized scan. Recommended for security experts for more frequent scans.
options.Faster: Faster - Scan will find about 85% vulnerabilities of equivalent non-optimized scan. Recommended for DevSecOps during ongoing evaluation.
options.Fastest: Fastest - Scan will find about 70% vulnerabilities of equivalent non-optimized scan. Recommended for Dev and QA during initial evaluation.
options.Optimization: No Optimization - Scan will test for all issues in the selected Test Policy Longest scan. Recommended for security experts before major releases, compliance and benchmarks.

inputs.helpMarkDown:
You can reduce scan time by choosing a balance between speed and issue coverage. Optimized scans omit tests defined in the Test policy for less severe or less likely vulnerabilities, based on ongoing statistical analyses. [Read more about test optimization](https://help.hcltechsw.com/appscan/Enterprise/10.0.6/topics/r_TestTestOptimization.html) 

 Note: The actual reduction in time, and extent of issue coverage, will vary depending on your application.

inputs.name: designatedAgentServerId
inputs.label: Designated Agent Server ID
inputs.helpMarkDown: The designated agent server ID for the scan. To get Designated Agent Server ID use GET /agentServer API.

inputs.name: suspend
inputs.label: Suspend job until security analysis completes
inputs.helpMarkDown: Suspend the job until the security analysis results are available.

inputs.name: failBuildConfiguration
inputs.label: Fail the build if one of the following conditions apply:
inputs.helpMarkDown: Configure the conditions that will cause the build to fail based on the results of the security scan.

inputs.name: buildfailTotal
inputs.label: Total
inputs.helpMarkDown: Fail the build if the total number of security issues is greater than the specified value.

inputs.name: buildfailconditionTotal
inputs.label: Security Issues greater than:
inputs.helpMarkDown: Threshold value to fail the build for total count of issues.

inputs.name: buildfailHigh
inputs.label: High
inputs.helpMarkDown: Fail the build if the number of High severity security issues is greater than the specified value.

inputs.name: buildfailconditionHigh
inputs.label: Security Issues greater than:
inputs.helpMarkDown: Threshold value to fail the build for high count of issues.

inputs.name: buildfailMedium
inputs.label: Medium
inputs.helpMarkDown: Fail the build if the number of Medium severity security issues is greater than the specified value.

inputs.name: buildfailconditionMedium
inputs.label: Security Issues greater than:
inputs.helpMarkDown: Threshold value to fail the build for medium count of issues.

inputs.name: buildfailLow
inputs.label: Low
inputs.helpMarkDown: Fail the build if the number of Low severity security issues is greater than the specified value.

inputs.name: buildfailconditionLow
inputs.label: Security Issues is greater than:
inputs.helpMarkDown: Threshold value to fail the build for low count of issues.
